section.title: Compiler Support
section.para: GNU/GCC is available also for Windows OS, via Minimalist GNU for Windows (MinGW)
The libiers10++ Software Package uses the C++11 ISO, which is supported by any version of GNU/GCC later than v4.3 (for a detailed list, see C++0x/C++11 Support in GCC).

important.para:
When compiling against the GNU/GCC compiler the user must set the appropriate flag for using the C++11 ISO. Depending on the version of the compiler, this can either be -std=c++11 (for versions later than v4.6), or -std=c++0x (for versions earlier than v4.6). To see what version of GNU/GCC you use, just type: bash$ g++ --version You should see an output simmilar to the following
g++ (GCC) 4.9.2 20150212 (Red Hat 4.9.2-6) Copyright (C) 2014 Free Software Foundation, Inc. This is free software; see the source for copying conditions. There is NO warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
where the version is clear in the first line (i.e. in this example v4.9.2).
